    3672           0 :         TextAttributes& setWidth( std::size_t _value )          { width = _value; return *this; }
    3673             :         TextAttributes& setTabChar( char _value )               { tabChar = _value; return *this; }
    3674             : 
    3675             :         std::size_t initialIndent;  // indent of first line, or npos
    3676             :         std::size_t indent;         // indent of subsequent lines, or all if initialIndent is npos
    3677             :         std::size_t width;          // maximum width of text, including indent. Longer text will wrap
    3678             :         char tabChar;               // If this char is seen the indent is changed to current pos
    3679             :     };
    3680             : 
    3681           0 :     class Text {
    3682             :     public:
    3683           0 :         Text( std::string const& _str, TextAttributes const& _attr = TextAttributes() )
    3684           0 :         : attr( _attr )
    3685             :         {
    3686           0 :             std::string wrappableChars = " [({.,/|\\-";
    3687           0 :             std::size_t indent = _attr.initialIndent != std::string::npos
    3688           0 :                 ? _attr.initialIndent
    3689             :                 : _attr.indent;
    3690           0 :             std::string remainder = _str;
    3691             : 
    3692           0 :             while( !remainder.empty() ) {
    3693           0 :                 if( lines.size() >= 1000 ) {
    3694           0 :                     lines.push_back( "... message truncated due to excessive size" );
    3695           0 :                     return;
    3696             :                 }
    3697           0 :                 std::size_t tabPos = std::string::npos;
    3698           0 :                 std::size_t width = (std::min)( remainder.size(), _attr.width - indent );
    3699           0 :                 std::size_t pos = remainder.find_first_of( '\n' );
    3700           0 :                 if( pos <= width ) {
    3701           0 :                     width = pos;
    3702             :                 }
    3703           0 :                 pos = remainder.find_last_of( _attr.tabChar, width );
    3704           0 :                 if( pos != std::string::npos ) {
    3705           0 :                     tabPos = pos;
    3706           0 :                     if( remainder[width] == '\n' )
    3707           0 :                         width--;
    3708           0 :                     remainder = remainder.substr( 0, tabPos ) + remainder.substr( tabPos+1 );
    3709             :                 }
    3710             : 
    3711           0 :                 if( width == remainder.size() ) {
    3712           0 :                     spliceLine( indent, remainder, width );
    3713             :                 }
    3714           0 :                 else if( remainder[width] == '\n' ) {
    3715           0 :                     spliceLine( indent, remainder, width );
    3716           0 :                     if( width <= 1 || remainder.size() != 1 )
    3717           0 :                         remainder = remainder.substr( 1 );
    3718           0 :                     indent = _attr.indent;
    3719             :                 }
    3720             :                 else {
    3721           0 :                     pos = remainder.find_last_of( wrappableChars, width );
    3722           0 :                     if( pos != std::string::npos && pos > 0 ) {
    3723           0 :                         spliceLine( indent, remainder, pos );
    3724           0 :                         if( remainder[0] == ' ' )
    3725           0 :                             remainder = remainder.substr( 1 );
    3726             :                     }
    3727             :                     else {
    3728           0 :                         spliceLine( indent, remainder, width-1 );
    3729           0 :                         lines.back() += "-";
    3730             :                     }
    3731           0 :                     if( lines.size() == 1 )
    3732           0 :                         indent = _attr.indent;
    3733           0 :                     if( tabPos != std::string::npos )
    3734           0 :                         indent += tabPos;
    3735             :                 }
    3736             :             }
    3737             :         }
    3738             : 
    3739           0 :         void spliceLine( std::size_t _indent, std::string& _remainder, std::size_t _pos ) {
    3740           0 :             lines.push_back( std::string( _indent, ' ' ) + _remainder.substr( 0, _pos ) );
    3741           0 :             _remainder = _remainder.substr( _pos );
    3742           0 :         }
    3743             : 
    3744             :         typedef std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator const_iterator;
    3745             : 
    3746             :         const_iterator begin() const { return lines.begin(); }
    3747             :         const_iterator end() const { return lines.end(); }
    3748             :         std::string const& last() const { return lines.back(); }
    3749           0 :         std::size_t size() const { return lines.size(); }
    3750           0 :         std::string const& operator[]( std::size_t _index ) const { return lines[_index]; }
    3751             :         std::string toString() const {
    3752             :             std::ostringstream oss;
    3753             :             oss << *this;
    3754             :             return oss.str();
    3755             :         }
    3756             : 
    3757             :         inline friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& _stream, Text const& _text ) {
    3758             :             for( Text::const_iterator it = _text.begin(), itEnd = _text.end();
    3759             :                 it != itEnd; ++it ) {
    3760             :                 if( it != _text.begin() )
    3761             :                     _stream << "\n";
    3762             :                 _stream << *it;
    3763             :             }
    3764             :             return _stream;
    3765             :         }
    3766             : 
    3767             :     private:
    3768             :         std::string str;
    3769             :         TextAttributes attr;
    3770             :         std::vector<std::string> lines;
    3771             :     };
    3772             : 
    3773             : } // end namespace Tbc
    3774             :

    3777             : #endif
    3778             : 
    3779             : #endif // TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_H_INCLUDED
    3780             : 
    3781             : // ----------- end of #include from tbc_text_format.h -----------
    3782             : // ........... back in clara.h
    3783             : 
    3784             : #undef STITCH_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OPEN_NAMESPACE
    3785             : 
    3786             : // ----------- #included from clara_compilers.h -----------
    3787             : 
    3788             : #ifndef TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    3789             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    3790             : 
    3791             : // Detect a number of compiler features - mostly C++11/14 conformance - by compiler
    3792             : // The following features are defined:
    3793             : //
    3794             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR : is nullptr supported?
    3795             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT : is noexcept supported?
    3796             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS : The delete and default keywords for compiler generated methods
    3797             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE : is override supported?
    3798             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR : is unique_ptr supported (otherwise use auto_ptr)
    3799             : 
    3800             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OR_GREATER : Is C++11 supported?
    3801             : 
    3802             : // CLARA_CONFIG_VARIADIC_MACROS : are variadic macros supported?
    3803             : 
    3804             : // In general each macro has a _NO_<feature name> form
    3805             : // (e.g. CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NULLPTR) which disables the feature.
    3806             : // Many features, at point of detection, define an _INTERNAL_ macro, so they
    3807             : // can be combined, en-mass, with the _NO_ forms later.
    3808             : 
    3809             : // All the C++11 features can be disabled with CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11
    3810             : 
    3811             : #ifdef __clang__
    3812             : 
    3813             : #if __has_feature(cxx_nullptr)
    3814             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    3815             : #endif
    3816             : 
    3817             : #if __has_feature(cxx_noexcept)
    3818             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    3819             : #endif
    3820             : 
    3821             : #endif // __clang__
    3822             : 
    3823             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    3824             : // GCC
    3825             : #ifdef __GNUC__
    3826             : 
    3827             : #if __GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 6 && defined(__GXX_EXPERIMENTAL_CXX0X__)
    3828             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    3829             : #endif
    3830             : 
    3831             : // - otherwise more recent versions define __cplusplus >= 201103L
    3832             : // and will get picked up below
    3833             : 
    3834             : #endif // __GNUC__
    3835             : 
    3836             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    3837             : // Visual C++
    3838             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    3839             : 
    3840             : #if (_MSC_VER >= 1600)
    3841             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    3842             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    3843             : #endif
    3844             : 
    3845             : #if (_MSC_VER >= 1900 ) // (VC++ 13 (VS2015))
    3846             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    3847             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    3848             : #endif
    3849             : 
    3850             : #endif // _MSC_VER
    3851             : 
    3852             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    3853             : // C++ language feature support
    3854             : 
    3855             : // catch all support for C++11
    3856             : #if defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201103L
    3857             : 
    3858             : #define CLARA_CPP11_OR_GREATER
    3859             : 
    3860             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR)
    3861             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    3862             : #endif
    3863             : 
    3864             : #ifndef CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    3865             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    3866             : #endif
    3867             : 
    3868             : #ifndef CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    3869             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    3870             : #endif
    3871             : 
    3872             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE)
    3873             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    3874             : #endif
    3875             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR)
    3876             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    3877             : #endif
    3878             : 
    3879             : #endif // __cplusplus >= 201103L
    3880             : 
    3881             : // Now set the actual defines based on the above + anything the user has configured
    3882             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    3883             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    3884             : #endif
    3885             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    3886             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    3887             : #endif
    3888             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    3889             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    3890             : #endif
    3891             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    3892             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    3893             : #endif
    3894             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    3895             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    3896             : #endif
    3897             : 
    3898             : // noexcept support:
    3899             : #if defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_NOEXCEPT)
    3900             : #define CLARA_NOEXCEPT noexcept
    3901             : #  define CLARA_NOEXCEPT_IS(x) noexcept(x)
    3902             : #else
    3903             : #define CLARA_NOEXCEPT throw()
    3904             : #  define CLARA_NOEXCEPT_IS(x)
    3905             : #endif
    3906             : 
    3907             : // nullptr support
    3908             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    3909             : #define CLARA_NULL nullptr
    3910             : #else
    3911             : #define CLARA_NULL NULL
    3912             : #endif
    3913             : 
    3914             : // override support
    3915             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    3916             : #define CLARA_OVERRIDE override
    3917             : #else
    3918             : #define CLARA_OVERRIDE
    3919             : #endif
    3920             : 
    3921             : // unique_ptr support
    3922             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    3923             : #   define CLARA_AUTO_PTR( T ) std::unique_ptr<T>
    3924             : #else
    3925             : #   define CLARA_AUTO_PTR( T ) std::auto_ptr<T>
    3926             : #endif
    3927             : 
    3928             : #endif // TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    3929             : 
    3930             : // ----------- end of #include from clara_compilers.h -----------
    3931             : // ........... back in clara.h
    3932             : 
    3933             : #include <map>
    3934             : #include <stdexcept>
    3935             : #include <memory>
    3936             :

    3967          56 :             return str.size() >= prefix.size() && str.substr( 0, prefix.size() ) == prefix;
    3968             :         }
    3969             : 
    3970             :         template<typename T> struct RemoveConstRef{ typedef T type; };
    3971             :         template<typename T> struct RemoveConstRef<T&>{ typedef T type; };
    3972             :         template<typename T> struct RemoveConstRef<T const&>{ typedef T type; };
    3973             :         template<typename T> struct RemoveConstRef<T const>{ typedef T type; };
    3974             :

    3976             :         template<>              struct IsBool<bool> { static const bool value = true; };

    3978             :         template<typename T>
    3979           0 :         void convertInto( std::string const& _source, T& _dest ) {
    3980           0 :             std::stringstream ss;
    3981           0 :             ss << _source;
    3982           0 :             ss >> _dest;
    3983           0 :             if( ss.fail() )
    3984           0 :                 throw std::runtime_error( "Unable to convert " + _source + " to destination type" );
    3985           0 :         }
    3986           1 :         inline void convertInto( std::string const& _source, std::string& _dest ) {
    3987           1 :             _dest = _source;
    3988           1 :         }
    3989           0 :         inline void convertInto( std::string const& _source, bool& _dest ) {
    3990           0 :             std::string sourceLC = _source;
    3991           0 :             std::transform( sourceLC.begin(), sourceLC.end(), sourceLC.begin(), ::tolower );
    3992           0 :             if( sourceLC == "y" || sourceLC == "1" || sourceLC == "true" || sourceLC == "yes" || sourceLC == "on" )
    3993           0 :                 _dest = true;
    3994           0 :             else if( sourceLC == "n" || sourceLC == "0" || sourceLC == "false" || sourceLC == "no" || sourceLC == "off" )
    3995           0 :                 _dest = false;
    3996             :             else
    3997           0 :                 throw std::runtime_error( "Expected a boolean value but did not recognise:\n  '" + _source + "'" );
    3998           0 :         }
    3999             : 
    4000             :         template<typename ConfigT>

    4016          25 :             BoundArgFunction( IArgFunction<ConfigT>* _functionObj ) : functionObj( _functionObj ) {}
    4017          53 :             BoundArgFunction( BoundArgFunction const& other ) : functionObj( other.functionObj ? other.functionObj->clone() : CLARA_NULL ) {}

    4019          24 :                 IArgFunction<ConfigT>* newFunctionObj = other.functionObj ? other.functionObj->clone() : CLARA_NULL;
    4020          24 :                 delete functionObj;

    4023             :             }
    4024         101 :             ~BoundArgFunction() { delete functionObj; }

    4110           1 :     inline std::vector<std::string> argsToVector( int argc, char const* const* const argv ) {
    4111           1 :         std::vector<std::string> args( static_cast<std::size_t>( argc ) );

    4113           1 :             args[i] = argv[i];
    4114             :

    4117             : 
    4118             :     class Parser {
    4119             :         enum Mode { None, MaybeShortOpt, SlashOpt, ShortOpt, LongOpt, Positional };
    4120             :         Mode mode;
    4121             :         std::size_t from;
    4122             :         bool inQuotes;
    4123             :     public:
    4124             : 
    4125           0 :         struct Token {
    4126             :             enum Type { Positional, ShortOpt, LongOpt };
    4127           0 :             Token( Type _type, std::string const& _data ) : type( _type ), data( _data ) {}
    4128             :             Type type;
    4129             :             std::string data;
    4130             :         };
    4131             : 
    4132           1 :         Parser() : mode( None ), from( 0 ), inQuotes( false ){}
    4133             : 
    4134           1 :         void parseIntoTokens( std::vector<std::string> const& args, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4135           2 :             const std::string doubleDash = "--";
    4136           1 :             for( std::size_t i = 1; i < args.size() && args[i] != doubleDash; ++i )
    4137           0 :                 parseIntoTokens( args[i], tokens);
    4138           1 :         }
    4139             : 
    4140           0 :         void parseIntoTokens( std::string const& arg, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4141           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i <= arg.size(); ++i ) {
    4142           0 :                 char c = arg[i];
    4143           0 :                 if( c == '"' )
    4144           0 :                     inQuotes = !inQuotes;
    4145           0 :                 mode = handleMode( i, c, arg, tokens );
    4146             :             }
    4147           0 :         }
    4148           0 :         Mode handleMode( std::size_t i, char c, std::string const& arg, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4149           0 :             switch( mode ) {
    4150           0 :                 case None: return handleNone( i, c );
    4151           0 :                 case MaybeShortOpt: return handleMaybeShortOpt( i, c );
    4152           0 :                 case ShortOpt:
    4153             :                 case LongOpt:
    4154           0 :                 case SlashOpt: return handleOpt( i, c, arg, tokens );

    4156           0 :                 default: throw std::logic_error( "Unknown mode" );

    4529           1 :         std::vector<Parser::Token> populateOptions( std::vector<Parser::Token> const& tokens, ConfigT& config ) const {

    4535           0 :                 for(; it != itEnd; ++it ) {
    4536           0 :                     Arg const& arg = *it;
    4537             : 
    4538             :                     try {
    4539           0 :                         if( ( token.type == Parser::Token::ShortOpt && arg.hasShortName( token.data ) ) ||
    4540           0 :                             ( token.type == Parser::Token::LongOpt && arg.hasLongName( token.data ) ) ) {

    4545           0 :                                     arg.boundField.set( config, tokens[++i].data );
    4546             :                             }
    4547             :                             else {
    4548           0 :                                 arg.boundField.set( config, "true" );
    4549             :                             }
    4550           0 :                             break;

    4869             : 
    4870             :     struct TextAttributes {
    4871           0 :         TextAttributes()
    4872           0 :         :   initialIndent( std::string::npos ),
    4873             :             indent( 0 ),
    4874             :             width( consoleWidth-1 ),
    4875           0 :             tabChar( '\t' )
    4876           0 :         {}
    4877             : 
    4878           0 :         TextAttributes& setInitialIndent( std::size_t _value )  { initialIndent = _value; return *this; }
    4879           0 :         TextAttributes& setIndent( std::size_t _value )         { indent = _value; return *this; }
    4880           0 :         TextAttributes& setWidth( std::size_t _value )          { width = _value; return *this; }
    4881             :         TextAttributes& setTabChar( char _value )               { tabChar = _value; return *this; }
    4882             : 
    4883             :         std::size_t initialIndent;  // indent of first line, or npos
    4884             :         std::size_t indent;         // indent of subsequent lines, or all if initialIndent is npos
    4885             :         std::size_t width;          // maximum width of text, including indent. Longer text will wrap
    4886             :         char tabChar;               // If this char is seen the indent is changed to current pos
    4887             :     };
    4888             : 
    4889           0 :     class Text {
    4890             :     public:
    4891           0 :         Text( std::string const& _str, TextAttributes const& _attr = TextAttributes() )
    4892           0 :         : attr( _attr )
    4893             :         {
    4894           0 :             std::string wrappableChars = " [({.,/|\\-";
    4895           0 :             std::size_t indent = _attr.initialIndent != std::string::npos
    4896           0 :                 ? _attr.initialIndent
    4897             :                 : _attr.indent;
    4898           0 :             std::string remainder = _str;
    4899             : 
    4900           0 :             while( !remainder.empty() ) {
    4901           0 :                 if( lines.size() >= 1000 ) {
    4902           0 :                     lines.push_back( "... message truncated due to excessive size" );
    4903           0 :                     return;
    4904             :                 }
    4905           0 :                 std::size_t tabPos = std::string::npos;
    4906           0 :                 std::size_t width = (std::min)( remainder.size(), _attr.width - indent );
    4907           0 :                 std::size_t pos = remainder.find_first_of( '\n' );
    4908           0 :                 if( pos <= width ) {
    4909           0 :                     width = pos;
    4910             :                 }
    4911           0 :                 pos = remainder.find_last_of( _attr.tabChar, width );
    4912           0 :                 if( pos != std::string::npos ) {
    4913           0 :                     tabPos = pos;
    4914           0 :                     if( remainder[width] == '\n' )
    4915           0 :                         width--;
    4916           0 :                     remainder = remainder.substr( 0, tabPos ) + remainder.substr( tabPos+1 );
    4917             :                 }
    4918             : 
    4919           0 :                 if( width == remainder.size() ) {
    4920           0 :                     spliceLine( indent, remainder, width );
    4921             :                 }
    4922           0 :                 else if( remainder[width] == '\n' ) {
    4923           0 :                     spliceLine( indent, remainder, width );
    4924           0 :                     if( width <= 1 || remainder.size() != 1 )
    4925           0 :                         remainder = remainder.substr( 1 );
    4926           0 :                     indent = _attr.indent;
    4927             :                 }
    4928             :                 else {
    4929           0 :                     pos = remainder.find_last_of( wrappableChars, width );
    4930           0 :                     if( pos != std::string::npos && pos > 0 ) {
    4931           0 :                         spliceLine( indent, remainder, pos );
    4932           0 :                         if( remainder[0] == ' ' )
    4933           0 :                             remainder = remainder.substr( 1 );
    4934             :                     }
    4935             :                     else {
    4936           0 :                         spliceLine( indent, remainder, width-1 );
    4937           0 :                         lines.back() += "-";
    4938             :                     }
    4939           0 :                     if( lines.size() == 1 )
    4940           0 :                         indent = _attr.indent;
    4941           0 :                     if( tabPos != std::string::npos )
    4942           0 :                         indent += tabPos;
    4943             :                 }
    4944             :             }
    4945             :         }
    4946             : 
    4947           0 :         void spliceLine( std::size_t _indent, std::string& _remainder, std::size_t _pos ) {
    4948           0 :             lines.push_back( std::string( _indent, ' ' ) + _remainder.substr( 0, _pos ) );
    4949           0 :             _remainder = _remainder.substr( _pos );
    4950           0 :         }
    4951             : 
    4952             :         typedef std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator const_iterator;

    4954           0 :         const_iterator begin() const { return lines.begin(); }
    4955           0 :         const_iterator end() const { return lines.end(); }

    4960             :             std::ostringstream oss;

    4962             :             return oss.str();
    4963             :         }

    5599             :         }
    5600          39 :         virtual bool isSuccessfullyCompleted() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    5601          39 :             return m_runState == CompletedSuccessfully;
    5602             :         }

    5604           0 :             return m_runState != NotStarted && !isComplete();
    5605             :         }

    5607           0 :             return !m_children.empty();

    5613             :

    6102          39 :         void runCurrentTest( std::string& redirectedCout, std::string& redirectedCerr ) {
    6103          39 :             TestCaseInfo const& testCaseInfo = m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo();
    6104          78 :             SectionInfo testCaseSection( testCaseInfo.lineInfo, testCaseInfo.name, testCaseInfo.description );
    6105          39 :             m_reporter->sectionStarting( testCaseSection );

    6107          39 :             double duration = 0;
    6108             :             try {
    6109          39 :                 m_lastAssertionInfo = AssertionInfo( "TEST_CASE", testCaseInfo.lineInfo, "", ResultDisposition::Normal );
    6110             : 
    6111          39 :                 seedRng( *m_config );
    6112             : 
    6113          39 :                 Timer timer;
    6114          39 :                 timer.start();
    6115          39 :                 if( m_reporter->getPreferences().shouldRedirectStdOut ) {
    6116           0 :                     StreamRedirect coutRedir( Catch::cout(), redirectedCout );
    6117           0 :                     StreamRedirect cerrRedir( Catch::cerr(), redirectedCerr );
    6118           0 :                     invokeActiveTestCase();
    6119             :                 }
    6120             :                 else {
    6121          39 :                     invokeActiveTestCase();
    6122             :                 }
    6123          39 :                 duration = timer.getElapsedSeconds();
    6124             :             }
    6125           0 :             catch( TestFailureException& ) {
    6126             :                 // This just means the test was aborted due to failure
    6127             :             }
    6128           0 :             catch(...) {
    6129           0 :                 makeUnexpectedResultBuilder().useActiveException();
    6130             :             }
    6131          39 :             m_testCaseTracker->close();
    6132          39 :             handleUnfinishedSections();
    6133          39 :             m_messages.clear();
    6134             : 
    6135          39 :             Counts assertions = m_totals.assertions - prevAssertions;
    6136          39 :             bool missingAssertions = testForMissingAssertions( assertions );
    6137             : 
    6138          39 :             if( testCaseInfo.okToFail() ) {

    6451           1 :     inline std::vector<TestCase> sortTests( IConfig const& config, std::vector<TestCase> const& unsortedTestCases ) {
    6452             : 
    6453           1 :         std::vector<TestCase> sorted = unsortedTestCases;

    6457           0 :                 std::sort( sorted.begin(), sorted.end(), LexSort() );

    6460             :                 {
    6461           0 :                     seedRng( config );
    6462             :

    6464           0 :                     std::random_shuffle( sorted.begin(), sorted.end(), rng );
    6465             :                 }
    6466           0 :                 break;
    6467           1 :             case RunTests::InDeclarationOrder:
    6468             :                 // already in declaration order
    6469           1 :                 break;
    6470             :         }
    6471           1 :         return sorted;
    6472             :     }

    6474          39 :         return testSpec.matches( testCase ) && ( config.allowThrows() || !testCase.throws() );

    6567          39 :     inline std::string extractClassName( std::string const& classOrQualifiedMethodName ) {
    6568          39 :         std::string className = classOrQualifiedMethodName;
    6569          39 :         if( startsWith( className, "&" ) )
    6570             :         {
    6571           0 :             std::size_t lastColons = className.rfind( "::" );

    6574           0 :                 penultimateColons = 1;
    6575           0 :             className = className.substr( penultimateColons, lastColons-penultimateColons );
    6576             :         }
    6577          39 :         return className;
    6578             :     }

    6828           0 :             sync();
    6829           0 :         }
    6830             :

    6832           0 :         int overflow( int c ) {
    6833           0 :             sync();

    6835           0 :             if( c != EOF ) {
    6836           0 :                 if( pbase() == epptr() )
    6837           0 :                     m_writer( std::string( 1, static_cast<char>( c ) ) );
    6838             :                 else
    6839           0 :                     sputc( static_cast<char>( c ) );
    6840             :             }
    6841           0 :             return 0;
    6842             :         }
    6843             : 
    6844           0 :         int sync() {
    6845           0 :             if( pbase() != pptr() ) {
    6846           0 :                 m_writer( std::string( pbase(), static_cast<std::string::size_type>( pptr() - pbase() ) ) );
    6847           0 :                 setp( pbase(), epptr() );
    6848             :             }
    6849           0 :             return 0;
    6850             :         }
    6851             :     };

    7044             :             originalForegroundAttributes = csbiInfo.wAttributes & ~( BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_RED | BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY );

    7046             :         }
    7047             : 
    7048             :         virtual void use( Colour::Code _colourCode ) {
    7049             :             switch( _colourCode ) {
    7050             :                 case Colour::None:      return setTextAttribute( originalForegroundAttributes );
    7051             :                 case Colour::White:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    7052             :                 case Colour::Red:       return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_RED );
    7053             :                 case Colour::Green:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7054             :                 case Colour::Blue:      return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    7055             :                 case Colour::Cyan:      return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7056             :                 case Colour::Yellow:    return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7057             :                 case Colour::Grey:      return setTextAttribute( 0 );
    7058             : 
    7059             :                 case Colour::LightGrey:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY );

    7061             :                 case Colour::BrightGreen:   return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7062             :                 case Colour::BrightWhite:   return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    7063             : 
    7064             :                 case Colour::Bright: throw std::logic_error( "not a colour" );
    7065             :             }
    7066             :         }
    7067             :

    7100             : namespace Catch {

    7102             : 
    7103             :     // use POSIX/ ANSI console terminal codes
    7104             :     // Thanks to Adam Strzelecki for original contribution
    7105             :     // (http://github.com/nanoant)
    7106             :     // https://github.com/philsquared/Catch/pull/131
    7107             :     class PosixColourImpl : public IColourImpl {
    7108             :     public:
    7109             :         virtual void use( Colour::Code _colourCode ) {
    7110             :             switch( _colourCode ) {
    7111             :                 case Colour::None:
    7112             :                 case Colour::White:     return setColour( "[0m" );
    7113             :                 case Colour::Red:       return setColour( "[0;31m" );
    7114             :                 case Colour::Green:     return setColour( "[0;32m" );
    7115             :                 case Colour::Blue:      return setColour( "[0:34m" );
    7116             :                 case Colour::Cyan:      return setColour( "[0;36m" );
    7117             :                 case Colour::Yellow:    return setColour( "[0;33m" );
    7118             :                 case Colour::Grey:      return setColour( "[1;30m" );
    7119             : 
    7120             :                 case Colour::LightGrey:     return setColour( "[0;37m" );
    7121             :                 case Colour::BrightRed:     return setColour( "[1;31m" );
    7122             :                 case Colour::BrightGreen:   return setColour( "[1;32m" );
    7123             :                 case Colour::BrightWhite:   return setColour( "[1;37m" );
    7124             : 
    7125             :                 case Colour::Bright: throw std::logic_error( "not a colour" );
    7126             :             }
    7127             :         }
    7128             :         static IColourImpl* instance() {
    7129             :             static PosixColourImpl s_instance;
    7130             :             return &s_instance;
    7131             :         }
    7132             : 
    7133             :     private:
    7134             :         void setColour( const char* _escapeCode ) {
    7135             :             Catch::cout() << '\033' << _escapeCode;
    7136             :         }
    7137             :     };
    7138             : 
    7139             :     IColourImpl* platformColourInstance() {
    7140             :         Ptr<IConfig const> config = getCurrentContext().getConfig();
    7141             :         UseColour::YesOrNo colourMode = config
    7142             :             ? config->useColour()
    7143             :             : UseColour::Auto;
    7144             :         if( colourMode == UseColour::Auto )
    7145             :             colourMode = (!isDebuggerActive() && isatty(STDOUT_FILENO) )
    7146             :                 ? UseColour::Yes
    7147             :                 : UseColour::No;
    7148             :         return colourMode == UseColour::Yes
    7149             :             ? PosixColourImpl::instance()
    7150             :             : NoColourImpl::instance();
    7151             :     }
    7152             : 
    7153             : } // end anon namespace
    7154             : } // end namespace Catch

    7345         117 :         else if( tag == "!shouldfail" )
    7346           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::ShouldFail;
    7347         117 :         else if( tag == "!mayfail" )
    7348           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::MayFail;
    7349             :         else
    7350         117 :             return TestCaseInfo::None;

    7352          39 :     inline bool isReservedTag( std::string const& tag ) {
    7353          39 :         return parseSpecialTag( tag ) == TestCaseInfo::None && tag.size() > 0 && !isalnum( tag[0] );
    7354             :     }
    7355          39 :     inline void enforceNotReservedTag( std::string const& tag, SourceLineInfo const& _lineInfo ) {

    7357             :             {
    7358           0 :                 Colour colourGuard( Colour::Red );

    7672           0 :     bool LegacyReporterAdapter::assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) {
    7673           0 :         if( assertionStats.assertionResult.getResultType() != ResultWas::Ok ) {
    7674           0 :             for( std::vector<MessageInfo>::const_iterator it = assertionStats.infoMessages.begin(), itEnd = assertionStats.infoMessages.end();
    7675           0 :                     it != itEnd;
    7676             :                     ++it ) {
    7677           0 :                 if( it->type == ResultWas::Info ) {
    7678           0 :                     ResultBuilder rb( it->macroName.c_str(), it->lineInfo, "", ResultDisposition::Normal );
    7679           0 :                     rb << it->message;
    7680           0 :                     rb.setResultType( ResultWas::Info );
    7681           0 :                     AssertionResult result = rb.build();
    7682           0 :                     m_legacyReporter->Result( result );
    7683             :                 }
    7684             :             }
    7685             :         }
    7686           0 :         m_legacyReporter->Result( assertionStats.assertionResult );
    7687           0 :         return true;
    7688             :     }
    7689           0 :     void LegacyReporterAdapter::sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) {
    7690           0 :         if( sectionStats.missingAssertions )
    7691           0 :             m_legacyReporter->NoAssertionsInSection( sectionStats.sectionInfo.name );
    7692           0 :         m_legacyReporter->EndSection( sectionStats.sectionInfo.name, sectionStats.assertions );
    7693           0 :     }
    7694           0 :     void LegacyReporterAdapter::testCaseEnded( TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats ) {

    7731             :             static uint64_t hz=0, hzo=0;
    7732             :             if (!hz) {
    7733             :                 QueryPerformanceFrequency( reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>( &hz ) );
    7734             :                 QueryPerformanceCounter( reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>( &hzo ) );
    7735             :             }
    7736             :             uint64_t t;
    7737             :             QueryPerformanceCounter( reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>( &t ) );
    7738             :             return ((t-hzo)*1000000)/hz;
    7739             :         }
    7740             : #else
    7741          78 :         uint64_t getCurrentTicks() {
    7742             :             timeval t;
    7743          78 :             gettimeofday(&t,CATCH_NULL);
    7744          78 :             return static_cast<uint64_t>( t.tv_sec ) * 1000000ull + static_cast<uint64_t>( t.tv_usec );
    7745             :         }
    7746             : #endif

    7793             : 
    7794           0 :         return start != std::string::npos ? str.substr( start, 1+end-start ) : "";

    7798           0 :         bool replaced = false;
    7799           0 :         std::size_t i = str.find( replaceThis );

    7801           0 :             replaced = true;
    7802           0 :             str = str.substr( 0, i ) + withThis + str.substr( i+replaceThis.size() );

    7807             :         }
    7808           0 :         return replaced;

    7905             : // #included from: catch_debugger.hpp
    7906             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_DEBUGGER_HPP_INCLUDED
    7907             : 
    7908             : #include <iostream>
    7909             : 
    7910             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    7911             : 
    7912             :     #include <assert.h>
    7913             :     #include <stdbool.h>
    7914             :     #include <sys/types.h>
    7915             :     #include <unistd.h>
    7916             :     #include <sys/sysctl.h>
    7917             : 
    7918             :     namespace Catch{
    7919             : 
    7920             :         // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
    7921             :         // http://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#qa/qa2004/qa1361.html
    7922             : 
    7923             :         // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
    7924             :         // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
    7925             :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    7926             : 
    7927             :             int                 mib[4];
    7928             :             struct kinfo_proc   info;
    7929             :             size_t              size;
    7930             : 
    7931             :             // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
    7932             :             // reason, we get a predictable result.
    7933             : 
    7934             :             info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
    7935             : 
    7936             :             // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
    7937             :             // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
    7938             : 
    7939             :             mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
    7940             :             mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
    7941             :             mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
    7942             :             mib[3] = getpid();
    7943             : 
    7944             :             // Call sysctl.
    7945             : 
    7946             :             size = sizeof(info);
    7947             :             if( sysctl(mib, sizeof(mib) / sizeof(*mib), &info, &size, CATCH_NULL, 0) != 0 ) {
    7948             :                 Catch::cerr() << "\n** Call to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is active **\n" << std::endl;
    7949             :                 return false;
    7950             :             }
    7951             : 
    7952             :             // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
    7953             : 
    7954             :             return ( (info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0 );
    7955             :         }
    7956             :     } // namespace Catch
    7957             : 
    7958             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
    7959             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    7960             :     namespace Catch {
    7961             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    7962             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    7963             :         }
    7964             :     }
    7965             : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
    7966             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    7967             :     namespace Catch {
    7968             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    7969             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    7970             :         }
    7971             :     }
    7972             : #else
    7973             :     namespace Catch {
    7974             :        inline bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
    7975             :     }
    7976             : #endif // Platform
    7977             :

    8005             : 
    8006             :         struct Endianness {
    8007             :             enum Arch { Big, Little };
    8008             : 
    8009           0 :             static Arch which() {
    8010             :                 union _{
    8011             :                     int asInt;
    8012             :                     char asChar[sizeof (int)];
    8013             :                 } u;
    8014             : 
    8015           0 :                 u.asInt = 1;
    8016           0 :                 return ( u.asChar[sizeof(int)-1] == 1 ) ? Big : Little;
    8017             :             }
    8018             :         };
    8019             :     }
    8020             : 
    8021           0 :     std::string rawMemoryToString( const void *object, std::size_t size )
    8022             :     {
    8023             :         // Reverse order for little endian architectures
    8024           0 :         int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1;
    8025           0 :         if( Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little ) {
    8026           0 :             i = end-1;
    8027           0 :             end = inc = -1;
    8028             :         }
    8029             : 
    8030           0 :         unsigned char const *bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>(object);
    8031           0 :         std::ostringstream os;
    8032           0 :         os << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
    8033           0 :         for( ; i != end; i += inc )
    8034           0 :              os << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
    8035           0 :        return os.str();
    8036             :     }
    8037             : }

    8039         110 : std::string toString( std::string const& value ) {
    8040         220 :     std::string s = value;

    8042           0 :         for(size_t i = 0; i < s.size(); ++i ) {
    8043           0 :             std::string subs;
    8044           0 :             switch( s[i] ) {
    8045           0 :             case '\n': subs = "\\n"; break;
    8046           0 :             case '\t': subs = "\\t"; break;
    8047           0 :             default: break;
    8048             :             }
    8049           0 :             if( !subs.empty() ) {
    8050           0 :                 s = s.substr( 0, i ) + subs + s.substr( i+1 );
    8051           0 :                 ++i;
    8052             :             }
    8053             :         }
    8054             :     }
    8055         220 :     return "\"" + s + "\"";

    8631             :     struct CumulativeReporterBase : SharedImpl<IStreamingReporter> {
    8632             :         template<typename T, typename ChildNodeT>
    8633             :         struct Node : SharedImpl<> {
    8634           0 :             explicit Node( T const& _value ) : value( _value ) {}
    8635           0 :             virtual ~Node() {}
    8636             : 
    8637             :             typedef std::vector<Ptr<ChildNodeT> > ChildNodes;
    8638             :             T value;
    8639             :             ChildNodes children;
    8640             :         };
    8641             :         struct SectionNode : SharedImpl<> {
    8642           0 :             explicit SectionNode( SectionStats const& _stats ) : stats( _stats ) {}
    8643             :             virtual ~SectionNode();
    8644             : 
    8645             :             bool operator == ( SectionNode const& other ) const {
    8646             :                 return stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo == other.stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo;
    8647             :             }
    8648             :             bool operator == ( Ptr<SectionNode> const& other ) const {
    8649             :                 return operator==( *other );
    8650             :             }
    8651             : 
    8652             :             SectionStats stats;
    8653             :             typedef std::vector<Ptr<SectionNode> > ChildSections;
    8654             :             typedef std::vector<AssertionStats> Assertions;
    8655             :             ChildSections childSections;
    8656             :             Assertions assertions;
    8657             :             std::string stdOut;
    8658             :             std::string stdErr;
    8659             :         };
    8660             : 
    8661             :         struct BySectionInfo {
    8662           0 :             BySectionInfo( SectionInfo const& other ) : m_other( other ) {}
    8663           0 :                         BySectionInfo( BySectionInfo const& other ) : m_other( other.m_other ) {}
    8664           0 :             bool operator() ( Ptr<SectionNode> const& node ) const {
    8665           0 :                 return node->stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo == m_other.lineInfo;
    8666             :             }
    8667             :         private:
    8668             :                         void operator=( BySectionInfo const& );
    8669             :             SectionInfo const& m_other;
    8670             :         };

    8694           0 :             SectionStats incompleteStats( sectionInfo, Counts(), 0, false );

    8713             :             }

    8803             :     class LegacyReporterRegistrar {
    8804             : 
    8805             :         class ReporterFactory : public IReporterFactory {
    8806             :             virtual IStreamingReporter* create( ReporterConfig const& config ) const {

    8821             : 
    8822             :     template<typename T>
    8823             :     class ReporterRegistrar {
    8824             : 
    8825          12 :         class ReporterFactory : public SharedImpl<IReporterFactory> {
    8826             : 
    8827             :             // *** Please Note ***:
    8828             :             // - If you end up here looking at a compiler error because it's trying to register
    8829             :             // your custom reporter class be aware that the native reporter interface has changed
    8830             :             // to IStreamingReporter. The "legacy" interface, IReporter, is still supported via
    8831             :             // an adapter. Just use REGISTER_LEGACY_REPORTER to take advantage of the adapter.
    8832             :             // However please consider updating to the new interface as the old one is now
    8833             :             // deprecated and will probably be removed quite soon!
    8834             :             // Please contact me via github if you have any questions at all about this.
    8835             :             // In fact, ideally, please contact me anyway to let me know you've hit this - as I have
    8836             :             // no idea who is actually using custom reporters at all (possibly no-one!).
    8837             :             // The new interface is designed to minimise exposure to interface changes in the future.
    8838           1 :             virtual IStreamingReporter* create( ReporterConfig const& config ) const {
    8839           1 :                 return new T( config );
    8840             :             }
    8841             : 
    8842           0 :             virtual std::string getDescription() const {
    8843           0 :                 return T::getDescription();
    8844             :             }
    8845             :         };
    8846             : 
    8847             :     public:
    8848             : 
    8849           4 :         ReporterRegistrar( std::string const& name ) {
    8850           4 :             getMutableRegistryHub().registerReporter( name, new ReporterFactory() );
    8851           4 :         }
    8852             :     };
    8853             :

    8860             :                 return new T( config );
    8861             :             }

    8863             :                 return "";
    8864             :             }

    8894           0 :     class XmlEncode {
    8895             :     public:
    8896             :         enum ForWhat { ForTextNodes, ForAttributes };
    8897             : 
    8898           0 :         XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat = ForTextNodes )
    8899           0 :         :   m_str( str ),
    8900           0 :             m_forWhat( forWhat )
    8901           0 :         {}
    8902             : 
    8903           0 :         void encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
    8904             : 
    8905             :             // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
    8906             :             // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
    8907             : 
    8908           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < m_str.size(); ++ i ) {
    8909           0 :                 char c = m_str[i];
    8910           0 :                 switch( c ) {
    8911           0 :                     case '<':   os << "&lt;"; break;
    8912           0 :                     case '&':   os << "&amp;"; break;
    8913             : 
    8914           0 :                     case '>':
    8915             :                         // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
    8916           0 :                         if( i > 2 && m_str[i-1] == ']' && m_str[i-2] == ']' )
    8917           0 :                             os << "&gt;";
    8918             :                         else
    8919           0 :                             os << c;
    8920           0 :                         break;
    8921             : 
    8922           0 :                     case '\"':
    8923           0 :                         if( m_forWhat == ForAttributes )
    8924           0 :                             os << "&quot;";
    8925             :                         else
    8926           0 :                             os << c;
    8927           0 :                         break;
    8928             : 
    8929           0 :                     default:
    8930             :                         // Escape control chars - based on contribution by @espenalb in PR #465
    8931           0 :                         if ( ( c < '\x09' ) || ( c > '\x0D' && c < '\x20') || c=='\x7F' )
    8932           0 :                             os << "&#x" << std::uppercase << std::hex << static_cast<int>( c );
    8933             :                         else
    8934           0 :                             os << c;
    8935             :                 }
    8936             :             }
    8937           0 :         }
    8938             : 
    8939           0 :         friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
    8940           0 :             xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
    8941           0 :             return os;
    8942             :         }
    8943             : 
    8944             :     private:
    8945             :         std::string m_str;
    8946             :         ForWhat m_forWhat;
    8947             :     };
    8948             :

    8950             :     public:
    8951             :

    9019           0 :             if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
    9020           0 :                 stream() << "/>\n";
    9021           0 :                 m_tagIsOpen = false;
    9022             :             }
    9023             :             else {
    9024           0 :                 stream() << m_indent << "</" << m_tags.back() << ">\n";
    9025             :             }
    9026           0 :             m_tags.pop_back();
    9027           0 :             return *this;
    9028             :         }

    9032           0 :                 stream() << " " << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << "\"";

    9035             :

    9038           0 :             return *this;
    9039             :         }
    9040             :

    9045           0 :             return writeAttribute( name, oss.str() );

    9051           0 :                 ensureTagClosed();

    9053           0 :                     stream() << m_indent;

    9056             :             }

    9058             :         }
    9059             :

    9063             :             m_needsNewline = true;
    9064             :             return *this;

    9163           0 :                 m_testCaseTimer.start();
    9164           0 :         }
    9165             : 
    9166           0 :         virtual void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9167           0 :             StreamingReporterBase::sectionStarting( sectionInfo );
    9168           0 :             if( m_sectionDepth++ > 0 ) {
    9169           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Section" )
    9170           0 :                     .writeAttribute( "name", trim( sectionInfo.name ) )
    9171           0 :                     .writeAttribute( "description", sectionInfo.description );
    9172             :             }
    9173           0 :         }
    9174             : 
    9175           0 :         virtual void assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& ) CATCH_OVERRIDE { }
    9176             : 
    9177           0 :         virtual bool assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9178           0 :             const AssertionResult& assertionResult = assertionStats.assertionResult;
    9179             : 
    9180             :             // Print any info messages in <Info> tags.
    9181           0 :             if( assertionStats.assertionResult.getResultType() != ResultWas::Ok ) {
    9182           0 :                 for( std::vector<MessageInfo>::const_iterator it = assertionStats.infoMessages.begin(), itEnd = assertionStats.infoMessages.end();
    9183           0 :                         it != itEnd;
    9184             :                         ++it ) {
    9185           0 :                     if( it->type == ResultWas::Info ) {
    9186           0 :                         m_xml.scopedElement( "Info" )
    9187           0 :                             .writeText( it->message );
    9188           0 :                     } else if ( it->type == ResultWas::Warning ) {
    9189           0 :                         m_xml.scopedElement( "Warning" )
    9190           0 :                             .writeText( it->message );
    9191             :                     }
    9192             :                 }
    9193             :             }
    9194             : 
    9195             :             // Drop out if result was successful but we're not printing them.
    9196           0 :             if( !m_config->includeSuccessfulResults() && isOk(assertionResult.getResultType()) )
    9197           0 :                 return true;
    9198             : 
    9199             :             // Print the expression if there is one.
    9200           0 :             if( assertionResult.hasExpression() ) {
    9201           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Expression" )
    9202           0 :                     .writeAttribute( "success", assertionResult.succeeded() )
    9203           0 :                                         .writeAttribute( "type", assertionResult.getTestMacroName() )

    9463           0 :                         elementName = "failure";

    9466           0 :                         elementName = "failure";

    9603           0 :         class AssertionPrinter {
    9604             :             void operator= ( AssertionPrinter const& );
    9605             :         public:
    9606           0 :             AssertionPrinter( std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages )
    9607           0 :             :   stream( _stream ),
    9608             :                 stats( _stats ),
    9609             :                 result( _stats.assertionResult ),
    9610             :                 colour( Colour::None ),
    9611           0 :                 message( result.getMessage() ),
    9612             :                 messages( _stats.infoMessages ),
    9613           0 :                 printInfoMessages( _printInfoMessages )
    9614             :             {
    9615           0 :                 switch( result.getResultType() ) {
    9616           0 :                     case ResultWas::Ok:
    9617           0 :                         colour = Colour::Success;
    9618           0 :                         passOrFail = "PASSED";
    9619             :                         //if( result.hasMessage() )
    9620           0 :                         if( _stats.infoMessages.size() == 1 )
    9621           0 :                             messageLabel = "with message";
    9622           0 :                         if( _stats.infoMessages.size() > 1 )
    9623           0 :                             messageLabel = "with messages";
    9624           0 :                         break;
    9625           0 :                     case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
    9626           0 :                         if( result.isOk() ) {
    9627           0 :                             colour = Colour::Success;
    9628           0 :                             passOrFail = "FAILED - but was ok";
    9629             :                         }
    9630             :                         else {
    9631           0 :                             colour = Colour::Error;
    9632           0 :                             passOrFail = "FAILED";
    9633             :                         }
    9634           0 :                         if( _stats.infoMessages.size() == 1 )
    9635           0 :                             messageLabel = "with message";
    9636           0 :                         if( _stats.infoMessages.size() > 1 )
    9637           0 :                             messageLabel = "with messages";
    9638           0 :                         break;
    9639           0 :                     case ResultWas::ThrewException:
    9640           0 :                         colour = Colour::Error;
    9641           0 :                         passOrFail = "FAILED";
    9642           0 :                         messageLabel = "due to unexpected exception with message";
    9643           0 :                         break;
    9644           0 :                     case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
    9645           0 :                         colour = Colour::Error;
    9646           0 :                         passOrFail = "FAILED";
    9647           0 :                         messageLabel = "due to a fatal error condition";
    9648           0 :                         break;
    9649           0 :                     case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
    9650           0 :                         colour = Colour::Error;
    9651           0 :                         passOrFail = "FAILED";
    9652           0 :                         messageLabel = "because no exception was thrown where one was expected";
    9653           0 :                         break;
    9654           0 :                     case ResultWas::Info:
    9655           0 :                         messageLabel = "info";
    9656           0 :                         break;
    9657           0 :                     case ResultWas::Warning:
    9658           0 :                         messageLabel = "warning";
    9659           0 :                         break;
    9660           0 :                     case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
    9661           0 :                         passOrFail = "FAILED";

    9664           0 :                             messageLabel = "explicitly with message";

    9666           0 :                             messageLabel = "explicitly with messages";
    9667           0 :                         break;
    9668             :                     // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
    9669           0 :                     case ResultWas::Unknown:
    9670             :                     case ResultWas::FailureBit:
    9671             :                     case ResultWas::Exception:
    9672           0 :                         passOrFail = "** internal error **";
    9673           0 :                         colour = Colour::Error;
    9674           0 :                         break;

    9676           0 :             }
    9677             : 
    9678           0 :             void print() const {
    9679           0 :                 printSourceInfo();
    9680           0 :                 if( stats.totals.assertions.total() > 0 ) {
    9681           0 :                     if( result.isOk() )
    9682           0 :                         stream << "\n";

    9684           0 :                     printOriginalExpression();
    9685           0 :                     printReconstructedExpression();
    9686             :                 }
    9687             :                 else {
    9688           0 :                     stream << "\n";
    9689             :                 }
    9690           0 :                 printMessage();
    9691           0 :             }
    9692             :

    9694           0 :             void printResultType() const {
    9695           0 :                 if( !passOrFail.empty() ) {
    9696           0 :                     Colour colourGuard( colour );

    9704           0 :                     stream << result.getExpressionInMacro();

    9707           0 :             }

    9710           0 :                     stream << "with expansion:\n";

    9808             :         // if string has a : in first line will set indent to follow it on
    9809             :         // subsequent lines

    9821           0 :         struct SummaryColumn {
    9822             : 
    9823           0 :             SummaryColumn( std::string const& _label, Colour::Code _colour )
    9824           0 :             :   label( _label ),
    9825           0 :                 colour( _colour )
    9826           0 :             {}
    9827           0 :             SummaryColumn addRow( std::size_t count ) {
    9828           0 :                 std::ostringstream oss;
    9829           0 :                 oss << count;
    9830           0 :                 std::string row = oss.str();

    9832           0 :                     while( it->size() < row.size() )
    9833           0 :                         *it = " " + *it;
    9834           0 :                     while( it->size() > row.size() )
    9835           0 :                         row = " " + row;
    9836             :                 }
    9837           0 :                 rows.push_back( row );
    9838           0 :                 return *this;
    9839             :             }

    9847           1 :         void printTotals( Totals const& totals ) {
    9848           1 :             if( totals.testCases.total() == 0 ) {
    9849           0 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << "No tests ran\n";
    9850             :             }
    9851           1 :             else if( totals.assertions.total() > 0 && totals.testCases.allPassed() ) {
    9852           1 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::ResultSuccess ) << "All tests passed";
    9853           1 :                 stream << " ("
    9854           2 :                         << pluralise( totals.assertions.passed, "assertion" ) << " in "
    9855           2 :                         << pluralise( totals.testCases.passed, "test case" ) << ")"
    9856           1 :                         << "\n";
    9857             :             }
    9858             :             else {
    9859             : 
    9860           0 :                 std::vector<SummaryColumn> columns;
    9861           0 :                 columns.push_back( SummaryColumn( "", Colour::None )
    9862           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.testCases.total() )
    9863           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.assertions.total() ) );
    9864           0 :                 columns.push_back( SummaryColumn( "passed", Colour::Success )
    9865           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.testCases.passed )
    9866           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.assertions.passed ) );
    9867           0 :                 columns.push_back( SummaryColumn( "failed", Colour::ResultError )
    9868           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.testCases.failed )
    9869           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.assertions.failed ) );
    9870           0 :                 columns.push_back( SummaryColumn( "failed as expected", Colour::ResultExpectedFailure )
    9871           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.testCases.failedButOk )
    9872           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.assertions.failedButOk ) );
    9873             : 
    9874           0 :                 printSummaryRow( "test cases", columns, 0 );
    9875           0 :                 printSummaryRow( "assertions", columns, 1 );
    9876             :             }
    9877           1 :         }
    9878           0 :         void printSummaryRow( std::string const& label, std::vector<SummaryColumn> const& cols, std::size_t row ) {
    9879           0 :             for( std::vector<SummaryColumn>::const_iterator it = cols.begin(); it != cols.end(); ++it ) {
    9880           0 :                 std::string value = it->rows[row];
    9881           0 :                 if( it->label.empty() ) {
    9882           0 :                     stream << label << ": ";
    9883           0 :                     if( value != "0" )
    9884           0 :                         stream << value;
    9885             :                     else
    9886           0 :                         stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << "- none -";
    9887             :                 }
    9888           0 :                 else if( value != "0" ) {
    9889           0 :                     stream  << Colour( Colour::LightGrey ) << " | ";
    9890           0 :                     stream  << Colour( it->colour )
    9891           0 :                             << value << " " << it->label;
    9892             :                 }
    9893             :             }
    9894           0 :             stream << "\n";
    9895           0 :         }
    9896             : 
    9897           3 :         static std::size_t makeRatio( std::size_t number, std::size_t total ) {
    9898           3 :             std::size_t ratio = total > 0 ? CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH * number/ total : 0;
    9899           3 :             return ( ratio == 0 && number > 0 ) ? 1 : ratio;
    9900             :         }
    9901           1 :         static std::size_t& findMax( std::size_t& i, std::size_t& j, std::size_t& k ) {
    9902           1 :             if( i > j && i > k )
    9903           0 :                 return i;
    9904           1 :             else if( j > k )
    9905           0 :                 return j;
    9906             :             else
    9907           1 :                 return k;
    9908             :         }
    9909             : 
    9910           1 :         void printTotalsDivider( Totals const& totals ) {
    9911           1 :             if( totals.testCases.total() > 0 ) {
    9912           1 :                 std::size_t failedRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.failed, totals.testCases.total() );
    9913           1 :                 std::size_t failedButOkRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.failedButOk, totals.testCases.total() );
    9914           1 :                 std::size_t passedRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.passed, totals.testCases.total() );
    9915           1 :                 while( failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1 )
    9916           0 :                     findMax( failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio )++;
    9917           3 :                 while( failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio > CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1 )
    9918           1 :                     findMax( failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio )--;
    9919             : 
    9920           1 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Error ) << std::string( failedRatio, '=' );
    9921           1 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::ResultExpectedFailure ) << std::string( failedButOkRatio, '=' );
    9922           1 :                 if( totals.testCases.allPassed() )
    9923           1 :                     stream << Colour( Colour::ResultSuccess ) << std::string( passedRatio, '=' );
    9924             :                 else
    9925           0 :                     stream << Colour( Colour::Success ) << std::string( passedRatio, '=' );
    9926             :             }
    9927             :             else {
    9928           0 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << std::string( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1, '=' );
    9929             :             }
    9930           1 :             stream << "\n";
    9931           1 :         }
    9932           0 :         void printSummaryDivider() {
    9933           0 :             stream << getLineOfChars<'-'>() << "\n";
    9934           0 :         }

    9981           0 :                 if( result.getResultType() != ResultWas::Warning )
    9982           0 :                     return false;

    9984             :             }
